pullRequest.title: CB-9524 - Skip swagger compatibility check if there is no api change in the pull request
pullRequest.bodyText:
The list of non-API modules is a hardcoded array
We iterate through all the changed files
Check if their module is one of the non-API modules
If yes, we add them to a collector array
If in the the size of the collector array equals the number of changed files, no swagger check is needed

nodes.bodyText:
Looks almost good, unfortunately, common is included in environment-api, so if you change things there it might be still unnoticed

  
    
      cloudbreak/environment-api/build.gradle
    
    
         Line 17
      in
      7959221
    
    
    
    

        
          
           implementation     project(":common") 
        
    
  


Can we also somehow check the transitive dependencies of the modules? Maybe it does not worth it, if it is too much effort...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,129 @@ Field_Separator=$IFS
 IFS=,
 set +e
 echo "Target branch for swagger check: ${CB_TARGET_BRANCH}"
+
+echo "Checking if there are any API changes between this and the target branch"
+git checkout $ghprbSourceBranch
+git reset --hard ${ghprbActualCommit}
+
+# list of the non-API modules
+declare -a nonApiModules=("cloud-reactor-api"
+  "common-handlebar"
+  "datalake"
+  "environment-log"
+  "idbmms-connector"
+  "redbeams-log"
+  "structuredevent-service-legacy"
+  "audit-connector"
+  "ccm-connector"
+  "cloud-reactor"
+  "docker-autoscale"
+  "environment"
+  "integration-test"
+  "redbeams-model"
+  "structuredevent-service"
+  "auth-connector"
+  "client-cm"
+  "cloud-template"
+  "common"
